eva

Interface Connection


  • public interface Connection
    A connection to a database, which can be used to submit transactions and retrieve the value of the database.

    Connections are cached, thread-safe, and intended to be long-lived.

    • Field Summary

      static java.lang.Object TX_DATA

      Yields the most recently known database snapshot, which is maintained in memory.

      Database syncDb()
      Like 'dbSnapshot', but forces reads from the backing store to assert whether or not the in-memory database snapshot is stale before returning.
      java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<java.util.Map> transact(java.util.List txData)
      Submits a transaction, blocking until a result is available.
      java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<java.util.Map> transactAsync(java.util.List txData)
      Like transact(List) but returns immediately without waiting for the transaction to complete.

    • Method Detail

      • dbSnapshot

        Database dbSnapshot()
        Yields the most recently known database snapshot, which is maintained in memory.
        Returns:
        immutable database value

      • db

        Database db()
        Same as 'dbSnapshot'.
        Returns:
        immutable database value

      • syncDb

        Database syncDb()
        Like 'dbSnapshot', but forces reads from the backing store to assert whether or not the in-memory database snapshot is stale before returning. If the snapshot is found to be stale, this call will block until the updated snapshot is produced from storage.

        Communicates only with storage.

        Intended for use when stale state on a Peer is suspected.

        Returns:
        immutable database value

      • dbAt

        Database dbAt(java.lang.Object t)
        Provides the database value at transaction t.
        Parameters:
        t - transaction id
        Returns:
        immutable database value at transaction t

      • release

        void release()
        Releases the resources associated with this connection.

        Connections are intended to be long-lived, so you should release a connection only when the entire program is finished with it (for example at program shutdown).

      • log

        Log log()
        Returns the current value of the transaction log. Communicates with storage, but not with the transactor
        Returns:
        immutable transaction log

      • latestT

        java.lang.Long latestT()
        Returns the latest tx-num that the Connection has updated its local state to match.
        Returns:
        the latest known tx-num on this connection

      • transact

        java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<java.util.Map> transact(java.util.List txData)
        Submits a transaction, blocking until a result is available.
        Parameters:
        txData - list of operations to be processed, including assertions, retractions, functions, or entity-maps
        Returns:
        a CompletableFuture which can monitor the status of the transaction. On successful commit, the future will contain a map of the following keys:
        DB_BEFORE
        database value before transaction was applied
        DB_AFTER
        database value after transaction was applied
        TX_DATA
        collection of primitive operations performed by the transaction
        TEMPIDS
        can be used with Peer.resolveTempId(Database, Object, Object) to resolve temporary ids used in the txData
        If the transaction fails or timed out, attempts to CompletableFuture.get() the future's value will raise an ExecutionException. When getting the result of the future, catch ExecutionException and call Throwable.getCause() to retrieve the underlying error.
        Throws:
        EvaException - raised if the internal state of the Connection is in a bad state. See EvaErrorCode for possible error causes.

      • transactAsync

        java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<java.util.Map> transactAsync(java.util.List txData)
        Like transact(List) but returns immediately without waiting for the transaction to complete.
        Parameters:
        txData - see transact(List)
        Returns:
        see transact(List)
        Throws:
        EvaException - raised if the internal state of the Connection is in a bad state. See EvaErrorCode for possible error cases.

      • status

        java.util.Map<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object> status()
        Get the status of this Connection to eva.
